Text: Intro
I was young when my ret’na met light
I close my eyes, and scene starts playing
It’s early days. Circuits still form in the morning air
In a sea of neurons, looking for connections
See neurons fire through a crowd
And say “Hello.” Little did they know
Signals were climbing up the optic nerve screaming
“Here is more input, so don’t you lose what you deserve!”
I hope these signals will not decay
And my connections stay-ay-ay
Then I said
Visual cortex, somewhere we can map the world
Synapses pruning, but the timing is unfurled
If we add some noise now, maybe pathways can stay—
It’s a vision story… plasticity finds a way
Early stripes, they are here lining my V1
Dominance columns findin’ their routine
LGN sends
Signals perfect tidy rows, oh, oh
“Using both my eyes now—my binocular strength grows!”
But then deprivation starts messing with the plan
Deprived eye, neurons pick a side. Lazy eye is getting suppressed
Still I said—
Visual cortex, somewhere we can map the world
Synapses pruning, but the timing is unfurled
If we add some noise now, maybe pathways can stay—
It’s a vision story… plasticity finds a way
Visual cortex, guide me—tell me circuits can adapt
Give the kids good input or their system might collapse
Is it too late now? Are the pathways still developing?
It’s a vision story...plasticy makes it okay
Oh-Ohhh
Critical windows closing
As I keep growing past the age 10
Perceptual learning swoops in
“Let’s make that weaker eye win!” And I said-

Synapses pruning, but the timing is unfurled
If we add some noise now, maybe pathways can stay—
It’s a vision story… plasticity finds a way
Visual cortex, guide me—tell me circuits can adapt
Give the kids good input or their system might collapse
Is it too late now? Are the pathways still developing?
It’s a vision story...plasticy makes it okay
Oh, oh
Oh, oh-oh, oh
Because we were young when the retina first met light…
